headline: Great Culture, Less Than Desirable Pay
pros: LogicMonitor has a great work life balance and the culture is also great. While the pandemic put a hold on lots of the in-office activities, people near the offices still have that benefit available to them. Lots of learning opportunities if you're willing to put in the extra time.
cons:
The pay is less than desirable. Many of my friends that have been around for years are leaving for jobs with 50% - 100% more pay. C level management seems to be brushing off the topic with no clear plan on how they will keep their employees. Valuable knowledge is lost in the process as new employees come in but senior members leave.

Stock incentive program is not clear at all with no clear picture as to what the actual worth of the stocks are. Newer employees are also getting less of it which is a shame. Eventually they will realize it's not worth as them made it seem.

Insurance plans keep getting more expensive year by year if you're covering family members.

Employees hired before 2021 are really feeling the pain of inflation, as they make less now than they did back when they were hired. With rising costs in living, transportation, food, this is not offset for existing employees. Existing employees are finding out how new hires are making more than they are as seniors.

Remote workers feel left out from the day to day activities that the different offices benefit from. If you were hired as a remote employee, you might be out of luck here.

headline: Pretty damn good
pros:
- The company offers lots of great perks. For example, they gave the entire company Fridays off for a month and they gave everyone bonuses to offset the office being closed because of COVID. Salaries are competitive.

- Great work environment. Everyone is friendly. Everyone is welcome to put forth ideas, from the newest, most junior person, to the most senior. Having an opinion is encouraged. People are passionate about trying to make LM a better product. 

- The company is invested in making the product better. They are not just maintaining old software and promising customers improvements that will never come (like so many companies do today). New features and refreshed designs are being implemented all of the time.

- Not overtly obsessed with "process." No one is calling you up and complaining that your time sheet isn't properly filled out. What matters most is getting the work done. (There is process where it matters, like anything security related.) 

- Leadership is generally pretty open and honest during the company all hands meetings.
cons:
- Benefits could be better. For example, their offerings for family/spouse benefits are a little weak and they don't offer some of the options available at other companies, like a legal protection plan or pet insurance.

- Can be political and promotions (and some hiring) often comes through patronage. I know at least one person who left the company specifically because the got the short end of a political fight.

- Can be a little 'sink or swim.' 

- Long term future of the company is a little uncertain. It is a small company going through a lot of growth, it is hard to predict where it will be in 2-3 years.

headline: Best place I've worked so far.

I came from big corporate and found working at a much smaller company to be truly refreshing. You can put forward ideas and expect to be heard. You are given the creative freedom to think about how to solve problems and empowered by the organization to solve them.

If you have talent, drive, and are a self-learner you will thrive here. But you will be put in many situations where you are the only one solving a given task and you may not have many people to lean on in finding a solution. So it can be a sink or swim situation if you are not confident in your abilities to do that.

But if you are able to do well in such situations you will be recognized and rewarded for it. 

For me, it's been a dream come true.
cons:
Sink or swim. Can expect to be put in stressful situations where you need to complete a task by a certain time with no exceptions due to various constraints in the organization. And you have to figure it out for yourself from the ground up most of the time.

If you are not able to this will be noticed immediately.

headline: Cultural Void, Unattainable Comp by Design, Private Equity Pump and Dump
pros:
*Excellent downtown location

*Product services a need in a pivoting marketplace
*Work/life balance above average
cons:
*Private equity implemented a backloaded comp plan, OTEs are largely unattainable.
*When they mention culture, they mean culture of fear. Someone is going to get fired at the end of every quarter. 
*Political imbalance is painfully obvious. 
*10-12 hours in forecast meetings/week.
*Redundant deal management processes and no single source of truth used by management teams. 
*Zero investment in enterprise pipeline generation from marketing.
*Smart leaders are stripped of any capability to effectively manage teams.
*B & C players succeed by floating questionable orders through partners.  Company paid commissions and recognized large deals  (six figures ore more) 90-120 days before customers signed agreements on more than one occasion.
*Standards for disciplinary action are arbitrary at best.
*Sales operations largely is inept, condescending, and lacks any collaborative skills.  
*Company delivered over their annual target to the parent organization, but less than 30% of sales organization came close to OTE.
*Sales cycles extremely long, largely due to inefficient operations/legal procedures and arrogant negotiation tactics. 
*Sales territories, account line sizes and role functions change frequently within fiscal quarters with little warning and no roll out plan. 
*Toxic pre employment personality/aptitude assessment weeds out qualified candidates 
*HR partners lack ability to remain objective and neutral in standard situations

This scientific tool is used to ensure we have a fair and consistent measure against hiring criteria. The assessment is one of many factors taken into consideration when making hiring decisions. In fact, everyone at LogicMonitor, from our CEO to our Interns, has completed the assessment.  

Check out these tips to ensure you're ready to go.

Here is what to Expect:

The assessment is split up into 2 parts, cognitive and personality, and will take 30 minutes total to complete.
For the Cognitive Assessment:
US and UK Candidates: You have 15 minutes to answer 50 multiple choice questions across 3 categories: math and logic, verbal ability, and spatial reasoning.  
If English is not your first language, we can provide a language agnostic version. Let us know and we will send you an updated link with a new assessment. Do not take this assessment.
Australia, Singapore, and India Candidates: You have 20 minutes to answer 40 multiple choice questions across 2 categories: math and logic, and spatial reasoning.  
Don't spend too much time on any one question. While the goal is to get as many answers correct as possible, best practice is to finish all the questions - even if this means you quickly guess on the last several questions if you are running out of time.
There is no penalty for a wrong answer, so if you aren't sure of the answer after 45 seconds, make your best guess.
You may use a pen and paper. You are NOT permitted to use calculators or any other problem-solving device such as Google.
We do verify test results with a follow up assessment if you move further in the process.
For the Personality Assessment:
You are responding to statements about yourself; answer in a way that most accurately describes you. Please don't feel pressured to answer how you "think" the system wants you to answer.
There are no right or wrong answers.
This section is not timed, but will take about 10 – 15 minutes to complete. Read each question completely before you answer, as some questions may appear similar. 
After the assessment, our hiring team will review the results and follow up with you on the next steps.
Make sure you have 30 minutes set aside with no distractions. The best thing you can do is prepare yourself as much as possible.

headline: Great People, Great Company

The emphasis they put on personal and professional harmony is unlike any I've ever seen and it makes me excited to come back everyday.
cons: The interview process can be rigid, too many assessments in my opinion, and 401k matching is not at market standard.

headline: Run away, don't walk!
pros: Good people in non-management positions-they really care about others. Great product although it's overly complicated. Compensation is on par with market.
cons: They tell you one thing in the interview, but then the job is completely different! Look at all the other negative reviews and you'll see a similar pattern. Also, when submitting a positive GlassDoor company review is on your Day 1 new hire checklist, you'll see how they are trying to drown out the authentic negative reviews (Good strategy-should have seen this red flag)!! The CSM and PM orgs have revolving doors-don't expect to spend more than 6 months there before some imaginative excuse is used to get rid of you. 401(k) match is 3%-mediocre at best. The product is overly complicated and lacks basic features like IPv6 support, a real working NetFlow product and restrictive API rate limits without any queuing for requests and it shows-customers are moving to DataDog, SolarWinds and others. Also, a SaaS infrastructure monitoring product that offers three 9s is umm sub-optimal. Last, but certainly not least, LM is a product-driven organization and what that means is, they will ignore the voice of customer and do what the 3 stooges (not my words, but funnily accurate) want. PS and Engineering groups are constantly at war! Remember companies that were at the top of their field, ignored the voice of the customer and did what they want aka made "technical sense"?-like Siebel, Blackberry, Palm, MySpace, Netscape, Kodak, etc, etc. You've been warned..

headline: Account Manager = Customer Failure Manager
pros:
-above average base salary for sales role and opportunity to achieve a high OTC (but no one achieves quota)
-product is good (but expensive)
-unlimited PTO (after 6 months of employment)
-potential for the company to be acquired, go public (lol), etc.
cons:
-micromanage culture in sales organization 
-frequent texts from management after business hours, including weekends
-insecure management additionally leverages performance plans as a CYA tactic, and plays it off as a method to develop you into a better employee
-crap compensation structure with unachievable quotas
-crap existing book of business (Account manager’s get penalized for not retaining business as part of their compensation package)
-crap training and training team (training team has no experience in sales and relies on internal employees to lead training discussions)
-company is consistently late on commission payments and often incorrect

The culture to expect in the LogicMonitor sales organization equals a low commission rate, plus small sales deals, plus high micromanagement.  The above average base salary is nice, but little transactional deals won’t get a sales rep to their (high and unattainable) quota.  

I was misled in the interviewing process about the company’s culture and compensation.  When I came onboard and recieved my book of business, I was further told that there's a lot of low hanging fruit to go after.  It was actually a lot of low hanging pile of crap.  Crap that I only got paid out 1.6% on the dollar for.  The insane level of micromanagement towards my pile of crap made myself hate working there altogether.  I NEVER felt like a valued employee.  I felt like the company’s punching bag.  This was the absolute worst sales experience I was ever apart of.  

I guess someone needed to be that punching bag to handle your legacy priced customers.

headline: Love my job!
pros:
Benefits Package: 
The LogicMonitor benefits package is one of the best out there. It is clear that the company cares about the needs of its employees. Unlimited PTO and a $1k bonus for completely unplugging from work for a week! 

Stellar Team:
Some of the brightest people I have had the privilege of working with. Everyone works hard but also likes to have a fun time in the office. I have felt comfortable talking to employees at all levels in the organization. 

Growth:
LogicMonitor is experiencing extreme growth and is predicted to continue on this trajectory. It is exciting to be a part of an organization that is experiencing great success. LogicMonitor moves incredibly quickly and there is never a dull moment here. 

Company Culture:
There are always events being put on and there is a lot of participation from the whole company. Happy hours, sports teams, free yoga classes,  you name it! 

Location: 
LogicMonitor is headquartered in beautiful Santa Barbara, CA and has recently moved into a new office that has a balcony that looks over the whole city. The view here really never gets old. 

I really do feel lucky to have a job that makes me excited to come into work every day.
cons: None that I can think of.

headline: Ruined me for any other job I'll ever have
pros:
LM is easily the best job I've had (been working in tech for 10 years) and, as the review title says, I'm going to have a tough time if I ever have to find another one.  Best things: lots of really smart, nice folks without big egos (data always wins over opinions); very flexible work schedules (for roles that don't depend on a set schedule) and vacation policy; great work office environment (I often choose it over working from home because it's so much fun).  There's a kegerator, lots of great snacks (healthy and not-so-much), and lots of opportunities for outdoor activities (beach parties, etc).  The office location is great, as it's right around the corner from State St and all sorts of lunchtime delights.  
The company is well-focused (they know what they're about and don't take knee-jerk detours into other areas), which makes the work itself more fun and easier to collaborate on.  I recommend a career at LM to my favorite people with no hesitation.
cons: None for me so far.

headline: Great Company, Amazing Culture, Fantastic People
pros:
I love coming to work and being surrounded by people that are passionate about the work they are doing, super talented, smart, and on top of that, a joy to be around. Everyone's work and opinions are valued and learning and development is highly encouraged and financially supported. It's great to work for a company that wants to help you grow and learn. Perks and benefits are fantastic. Unlimited snacks, free lunches, happy hours, chair massages, in-house yoga and workout classes, beer on tap, a meditation room, I could go on and on about all of the perks!

The Austin office is in the heart of downtown, in the "Google building" with a floor to ceiling windows boasting a fantastic view. The office itself is open concept with a fun modern design, which encourages open communication across departments and really makes everyone feel like one team. Equally, there are conference rooms and phones rooms when you want to buckle down on projects individually.
cons: Parking in downtown Austin is no fun. LM helps with paying for part of it. 401k matching would also be amazing :)

headline: I love my job
pros:
LogicMonitor is a incredible place to work. Downtown location in Santa Barbara, CA keeps you motivated and entertained. If you need to take a walk and take a break, go for it! 

Amenities aren't bad either. Fully stoked kitchen, beer on tap, bike racks if you want to ride in, and ping-pong table. Company pays for a yoga instructor once a week and are always looking for ways to keep us active. 

I always feel challenged working at a company that is constantly evolving. My team I couldn't be more happy with and supported by. We really are a cohesive unit that help one another out all the time.
cons: A company that is constantly evolving is quite fun, sure, but it can also be really hard to keep up. LogicMonitor isn't necessarily a start-up anymore so some of those transitions are hard to make. Working in an open office environment is also fun but sometimes is can get quite loud.

headline: Great People, Great Product....a few growing pains
pros: We have done a great job of creating a phenomenal product .  There is a level of autonomy where you get to take personal responsibility for the outcome of  the product and how the company progresses and grows. The culture at LogicMonitor is absolutely special, not because of the perks or the location (which is not bad) but because of the emphasis on family and being this tight knit community. It also doesn't suck when people come to work because of their passion for the company/product and not just to collect a paycheck.
cons: We run into growing pains (which any small-mid size company goes through). Priorities are constantly changing and its important to not lose sight of our goals through transitions. We also have to make sure we continue the culture that makes LM great...culture is home grown, not defined by management.

headline: Greatest Place to Work in Santa Barbara
pros: So there are some great perks, like gym reimbursement, covered costs of continued learning, yearly $1000 bonus for completely unplugging from work for 1 week, stocked fridge, beer, but those are just added bonuses.  The biggest pro of working at LogicMonitor, is being part of the LogicMonitor team, and to use an analogy, at previous companies everyone was looking for their piece of the pie, but here, everyone is helping bake the pie.  You will never have a chance to work with this caliber of people, and I'm not just talking about people with high levels of education.  Everyone that works here works hard, and have a high level of social grace and affability.
cons: None, there are literally no cons to working at LogicMonitor.  If I were to think of something, I live out of town, so I have to commute.

headline: Fantastic, transparent hiring, no waiting
pros:
While I've only been with the company for a short time, I have been very impressed with the responsiveness of LogicMonitor's talent acquisition and people operations staff. 

From submitting my application, to receiving my offer letter the process took about 5 days total, during which time I was kept up to date with all phases of the hiring process.

Rather than being subjected to days or weeks of waiting and follow-ups, the company was very forward about their interest in me and was able to get all phone interviewing completed on my schedule in one day, and then a single in-person interview session with multiple levels of my department leadership.

Everybody is friendly and the welcomes have been warm, I can't wait to see what more the future brings.
cons: So far I have not come across any downside to this fantastic company, but I'll say the parking situation is a bit of a mess.

headline: Great place to work with a few growing pains.
pros:
Categorically, this is an incredible place, with people who not only support each other in their professional lives, but also in their personal ones. The work is constantly fast paced, challenging and rewarding. 

One of the massive differentiators for this company from any other startup that I have worked for in the past is that we are one of our own biggest customers. Having that level of expertise and 24/7 involvement with out own product (from the point of view of the customer) brings every department closer to the user and gives a great sense of purpose beyond just building a company.
cons: Going hand in hand with such a fast pace comes some growing pains. Having seen this transition point in other start-ups, fast becoming medium businesses, these are not uncommon issues, but issues none-the-less. With growth comes reorganization, and with reorganization comes some amount of confusion. While the primary goals, and underlying culture stay strong, there can be challenges on a day-to-day or project specific level which come with shifting priorities,

The other thing that's great about LogicMonitor is that we have an active lifestyle here. The kitchen is fully stocked with healthy food, the company puts on weekly activities like indoor soccer, basketball, volleyball, softball, and every loves to hike when they can.

pros: LogicMonitor has an environment where everybody seems to embrace a deep sense of responsibility, dedication, and care about their role in making a product and service that truly shines and helps people. And they have fun doing it. Needless to say, the team-bond is strong, and employee personal health and wellbeing is fully appreciated and respected, and it shows because I go in to work I feel like everybody is happy to be there! Take this opportunity if you can and make the best of it, and be awesome.
cons: Do notice I said job instead of career. As great as things can be, sometimes I don't see this opportunity as going much more past the job-realm. But your mileage may vary and if you are determined enough, anything should be possible. Nevertheless, my experience here has been most-amazing and I have learned a lot!

headline: AMAZING EMPLOYER!!

LM has an amazing culture with many opportunities for growth within the company.  They truly provide an entrepreneurial spirit where each employee is the master of their own destiny.

Everyone I've worked with is extremely bright and really pleasant.  I think the fun activities and outings are great bonding experiences and create a really happy work environment and a close-knit team.  This in turn creates a very efficient team that can move projects forward in a timely manner.

It has truly been an amazing place to work and I am very grateful to get to come here every day!

headline: It's a ride
pros: Smart folks to work with and a general attitude of just getting stuff done, especially in the technical arena.  There is always work to do, but also latitude and encouragement to work on technical projects of your choosing as long as you are getting your assigned tasks and projects completed.  Some major features and integrations have come from engineers doing just this.
cons: It is not for the feint of heart.  Things are moving fast which leads to a lack of structure.  This is a positive for some but not all as it can be frustrating to not receive constant feedback.  Those who work hard are generally rewarded, though not necessarily on the timeframe they may hope for.

headline: Just ask one question
pros: The offices are in fantastic locations. The customer success team has some of the hardest working people you will ever meet. They are desperately trying to hold the old company culture together. The engineering and product teams are absolutely brilliant. They work on industry changing solutions every day. Steve Francis is a genius.
cons:
How many account executives have hit quota this quarter? How about last quarter?
No no, don't include the account managers who are growing the install base that was removed from all the account executives book of business. How many pure acquisition account executives. Insist to speak with them directly to get a feel for their experience after the acquisition by Vista Equity. Ask them how many quality leads have they gotten in the last 6 months? How many of them have resulted in a new customer?

headline: Amazing place to work!
pros:
1. The people and culture are phenomenal and you can tell that folks genuinely care about the company. 
2. The Austin office is in an awesome location. 
3. Steps for career growth were provided to me my first week.
4. Learning and development is readily available for the LM product for all employees. Personal career interests and growth is supported.
cons: Some changes in leadership have come through with the acquisition, but it's to be expected.

headline: Love this place!
pros: Amazing place to work.  I've worked at great companies before, but this one is different - sets the bar to another level.  People are smart, I get to do difficult projects, and get great benefits.   All while working in an amazing city.  Don't know how I got this lucky.
cons: Growing super fast.  Some people may not want to be at a high growth company - and that is ok.  Just need to know that things are changing - not in a bad way necessarily, but it is changing.

headline: Great
pros:
Challenging, dynamic, interesting environment.  If you thrive on hard work and success, this is your place.  There is always room for smart, productive people who can take responsibility to find problems and provide solutions.

Terrific product.  LogicMonitor will probably succeed if they can manage the growth.

It's a really fun place to work.  Mostly great people.  The way LogicMonitor has kept their company culture to date is remarkable.
cons:
-Insulated executive staff
-growing too fast and it shows
-low pay for experience
-promotions only seem to happen to people who work with executives

headline: Couldn't ask for a better place to work
pros: The LM team is made up of some of the most intelligent, genuinely hardworking people you will ever meet. The company truly invests in its employees and works hard to foster a supportive, fun environment where team members feel valued. It doesn't matter what role you play in the company - new ideas and opinions are always welcome! I never thought I'd say this but, I LOVE MY JOB!
cons: Be warned, LogicMonitor may ruin you. There's a good chance you won't want to work anywhere else. Ever again. I mean c'mon, craft beer on tap and a fully stocked kitchen? That's hard to beat.

headline: Great Technical Product, lots of learning opportunity
pros:
- Very technical product
- Will get to work with extremely cutting edge technologies
- team is continuously striving to adopt best practices and
- regular tech talks to share new knowledge
- everyone will try to assist new hires to ramp up quickly
cons: - Nothing major. The technical nature of the product means the initial learning curve might be a bit steep. Since the company is growing very fast, there is a lot of work to be done at any moment, so good communication is required with the stakeholders to ensure work is correctly prioritized.

headline: Great Company to Work For!
pros: LogicMonitor employs a lot of really, really talented people.  There is a great deal of creativity that is fostered with managers who care a lot about ideas coming to the surface.  I'm excited to continue growing with a company that values individuality and innovation.
cons: None to note as of now.

headline: Great place for smart people
pros: If you're driven and have good ideas, nobody will stop you.  For better or for worse, you won't be heavily managed.  Tons of potential for the right people.
cons: You won't receive daily, weekly, or even monthly status reviews.  If you are the kind that needs re-affirmations, constant direction, or can't figure out something productive to do on your own, you'll not do well.  There are smart people who can be un-intentionally abusive if you proffer ideas that aren't well founded, especially in the technical areas.

headline: All my friends wish they worked here
pros:
-Great Benefits and an awesome work/life balance culture
-Fun and smart people to work with
-The product is awesome and always improving
cons:
-It's a sink or swim autonomous atmosphere so you need to be a self-starter and motivated or else you will feel lost quickly
-it's a startup so we are still gettin processes and procedures worked out but this also means you get more of a say in those processes and procedures

headline: Great culture, great people, great opportunities!
pros: I can honestly say that joining LogicMonitor has been one of the best decision I've made in my professional career.  The company culture is amazing ... all those sounds-to-good-to-be-true perks listed on the website / job description ... well, they're true. They really give a great snapshot of what a career at LogicMonitor looks like.  The employees and executives are enthusiastic, responsive, and engaging. It's a place where your voice can be heard, you can make real change, and you get to participate in the successes of your hard work. There is great flexibility / work-life balance and the compensation / benefits are rewarding and equitable. The Company does a great job at recognizing the successes of the Company as well as the individual. Whether it's yoga, basketball, ping pong battles, company beach days, Friday cross-department trainings with beer from the office kegerator ... you really feel like your part of a great family at work. But equally importantly, the people at LogicMonitor are driven to making the company a success. The company provides its employees with the tools and resources to succeed and supports the creative, innovative, and motivated employees that are driving the company forward. It's that perfect mix of hard-work and great culture that's exactly what I want in my career. My Manager has been incredibly supportive, both of my career and my personal life. We meet regularly once a week to discuss ongoing activities in the department, my future career goals, and how I'm doing as an individual. This all might sound like company hoo-rah, but it's really the best way to reflect what it's like to work at LogicMonitor.
cons: With great growth, comes great demand. This isn't a "con" per se, but something to be ready for ... it's definitely a work-hard, play-hard mentality. There's time where long hours are necessary, but unlike other jobs I've had in the past, the hard-work comes from a motivation / drive from the project at hand ... and is rewarded / recognized when the project is complete.

headline: Rare find of bright, motivated, fun environment to work in.
pros: As the title states, the vast majority of the people at LogicMonitor are smart, motivated and enjoyable to work with.  The company is growing at a steady rate and continues to prove that it has one of the best products in its space.
cons: Sometimes there's a slight lack of communication between teams, but this rarely leads to friction.  Rather, you'll find that two people have accomplished the same tasks (sometimes) via two different methods.

headline: Growing startup with bright future
pros: This company centers around a truly awesome SaaS project that people love. The passion is contagious and there are plenty of smart people doing impressive work. Great balance of fun/startup culture with seniority and maturity at the leadership level. Perks and compensation are top-notch. Promoting from within is common; employees feel empowered and that anything is possible here.
cons: An increasing need to stay focused doesn't always work well in a relaxed, carefree, open work environment.

headline: Best Place I’ve ever worked.
pros: Great people, product addresses the market perfectly. The Teams allow autonomy and creativity!
cons: There is no “utopia” and of course there are certain things that can always get better.  However unhappy people here typically have similar “views” in other areas of their lives.  Control what you can control and LM is a great place to be!

headline: Best job so far.
pros: One of my favorite parts about working at LogicMonitor is the great company culture. We have a team that genuinely likes coming into work and collaborating with each other. Another bonus is the leadership team. They recognize peoples strengths and help them create a job to maximize their potential.
cons: We are in hyper-growth right now so things are moving really fast across all departments. This can make it difficult to learn our extremely technical platform, but the team does a great job making sure you're set up for success.

headline: Great company to check out and work for!
pros:
Great product
Great work environment and employees
Great benefits
Great engagement by management
cons: Structure of on the job training is still a little "unstructured" as they try to move towards exact duplication for each new employee based on their job role.  However, all current employees working in the role that you are hired for are really willing to help out and ensure that you know and fully understand the major points of your job duties.  You won't feel like you don't know enough to perform your job.

headline: Fun and challenging
pros:
- Lots of learning and lots of hard challenges
- Surrounded by smart and motivated people
- Everyone is eager to help if you ask
- Recognition for good work
- Very nice office, great ocean view, food and snacks, ping pong, foosball, and beer
- Healthy lifestyle is part of the culture
cons:
- Hard problems and lots of work can sometimes get overwhelming
- We need more good software engineers to join the team

headline: Amazing Environment
pros: LogicMonitor is an amazing place to work if you are a driven person. There is a ton of room to grow and to make a name for yourself. Everyone is very friendly and looking for team success. This is the first job where I have felt completely apart of a team and family.
cons: You HAVE to be self motivated. No one has time to bug you about getting things done. If you are someone that needs a lot of management and direction, run far, far away.

headline: Fun culture with room for career growth
pros:
-surrounded by a very active group of people - some hobbies of my coworkers include kickboxing, rock climbing, hiking, ceramics, surfing, etc. You will always find people doing something new.
-weekly workout classes offered - yoga, pilates, & strength training
-we have a great product with a real potential to capture the market if we make the right moves
cons: -with under 100 employees it would be nice to have the majority of us in one office

headline: Great Culture, Great Opportunities
pros: You really have the opportunity to be the driver of your own career here. They sincerely higher good people and encourage them to follow a path that is exciting for them. This allows the employee to thrive and creates an awesome culture. You don't necessarily have to follow a linear path. You can move departments entirely if the fit is right
cons: There is always a lot to do, so if you need someone to tell you what to do next, you might not be the best fit.

headline: Great people, disruptive product, exciting market and attractive benefits
pros:
-I get to work with a ton of intelligent, dedicated and interesting people in a laid-back environment.
-Executives are responsive; the feedback loop is both efficient and effective
-Growth is abundant; a savvy employee who contributes to the team can make parallel and vertical moves quickly
-The product is lightyears ahead of its competitors and easy to get behind
cons: The executives are seeking responsible, managed growth which can - at times - seem slow, depending on what you're used to/looking for.

headline: You can't beat a positive attitude!
pros: I don't think I've ever worked at a company that has such a positive attitude as LogicMonitor. People seem truly happy and upbeat. They believe problems are opportunities and work together to fix things that are broken and recognize people for their contributions. I feel very lucky to have landed here.
cons: Like most places in California, Santa Barbara is not a cheap place to live.  You have to be pretty scrappy to find a good place but once you do it's worth it.

headline: Great Place to Work
pros:
- Strong focus on employee satisfaction
- Healthy work/life balance
- Multiple comp benefits
- Management/supervisors encourage feedback, highly transparent
- Lots of events outside of work that are actually really fun
- Co-workers are super friendly, great to be around
cons:
- Typical growing pace of fast-growing companies, but nothing that takes away from being a great workplace.  
- The product is constantly being updated with improvements, however they happen so quickly it sometimes can be difficult to keep track.

headline: Leading company with exciting opportunities
pros: LogicMonitor is an incredibly exciting place to work. We have a market leading product and an amazing company culture. Because the company is growing so quickly, everyone really has the opportunity to create their position and grow with new roles and responsibilities.
cons: Since the company is growing so quickly and needing so many new resources, most employees end up taking on much more than their role - which is an incredible learning experience, but can be overwhelming at times.

headline: Great Interview Experience!
pros:
Yasmeen, Vianna, Jessica and the team were amazing at guiding me through the interview process. Very transparent and quick to respond when I had questions. Everyone I spoke with was nice, helpful and provided wonderful insight into the company. I'd met some amazing contacts who wanted to keep in touch regardless of the outcome.

It's easy to give a good review when you are hired, but my thoughts would be similar if I hadn't been hired or chosen LogicMonitor.
cons: I can't think of any.

headline: Great team and fun place to work
pros: I have a huge opportunity to make a meaningful impact here because LogicMonitor trusts its team. I love the people I work with (most of us hang out on the weekends) and then benefits and work culture are pretty great.
cons: We move at an extremely fast pace which I personally thrive in but I see others struggle with it. I would say this is the nature of a fast growing company where there are many high priorities to juggle.

headline: Excellent hiring process and culture
pros: I recently went through the new hire process for LogicMonitor. From my first contact with a recruiter to being hired was only about a two week process. They were very informative and open during the whole process and struck a good balance between professionalism and having fun. I am very excited to begin my career here.
cons: The hiring process is very competitive which may be hard for some people.

headline: Growing with LogicMonitor
pros:
Very dynamic work environment
Surrounded by bright, capable, motivated people
Great location and office facilities
Plenty of opportunity for career advancement and continuing education
Many great employee benefits
Dogs at work!
Really valuable product and great business outlook
Feeling of community
cons:
Sometimes responsible for tasks/duties outside of your job description
Open office not for everyone
Highly technical product can be difficult for non-technical people to grasp
The business and individual priorities are constantly changing and shifting (good and bad)
Communication between teams is lacking at times, but I have seen improvement

headline: Look forward to coming to work!
pros:
- Truly believe in helping their customer's succeed
- Continually advancing product to stay ahead of the market and grow
- Fun atmosphere with a work hard, play hard attitude
- Great benefits
cons:
- Current office location/space
- Availability for growth within Austin
- Fast paced, prepare to hit the ground running and learning by experience

headline: Great place to work
pros: Super positive environment with encouragement to grow your capabilities.  Everyone is very supportive and helpful when questions arise.  The vibe is very energetic every day.  There are company wide training sessions weekly that enable everyone to learn about different aspects of what is happening within the company as a whole.  A great place to work.
cons: I can't think of anything bad about working here.

headline: Energizing & Challenging - but fun!
pros: So much opportunity. From the top down employees are welcomed into the LogicMonitor team with open arms and free T-shirts & gear. Each employee has clear goals with a custom scorecard to direct you. Diverse smart teams but lots of fun factor.
cons: We are lean and growing as the business needs. Sometimes it means extra work out or normal hours to accomplish goals.

headline: Great place to work and grow your career!
pros:
-There are many fantastic opportunities to learn about the business and grow your career.
-LogicMonitor fosters an entrepreneurial environment. Employees are self starters and function with little hands on management. 
-Employees are a very tight knit group and enjoy spending time together at and outside of work. 
-The culture and benefits are fantastic!
cons: -LogicMonitor is growing very fast. There is always a ton to do and sometimes it is difficult to prioritize projects.

headline: Remarkable Company
pros: I have never worked for a company as considerate of their employees as LogicMonitor. The company culture is fantastic, and I am excited to be a part of this rapidly growing company.
cons: IT is a difficult field to jump into without an IT background, so it takes a lot of time to learn. More a con of the industry itself than the company itself - they take the time to teach you.

headline: Small size companies are great
pros:
1) Lots of positive energy
2) Fun culture - outings are fun but not too $$ wasteful
3) Focus on informal training for all employees (2x per week)
4) Founders work in offices almost daily
5) Coworkers are friendly and welcoming

1) Hard to resist the yummy snacks - I gained 20 pounds!
2) Downtown parking is a hassle...but I like riding my bike anyways
3) The usual growing pains

headline: Love it here.
pros:
- Treated well and fairly.
- Communication between team members and cross-departments is great.
- Engaging and challenging.
- Continuously exploring new technologies which is quite.
- Company sponsored events ( outings, sports, etc.)

- Never dread Mondays anymore.

-Awesome location

headline: Great Culture, High Integrity Team
pros: This company is up to something very big.  The people are very high level and the product is very good.
cons: Communication & vision can be more clearly articulated from Top-Down.

headline: Great company
pros: Open communication is facilitated on teams and with management. Management is flexible and more understanding than most companies. Company places a lot of emphasis on learning and everyone I've talked with is open to teaching new people about the product.
cons: Fairly homogenous company culture that feels exclusive to the other.

headline: Seemless, straight-forward hiring experience
pros: This is a company that has their stuff together. The interview and onboarding process was well documented and very straight forward. They were transparent about the whole process, career development, and long term strategy upfront. So far it's been a great experience.
cons: Growth is fast, leaving little space in the office to network. Desks are limited and multiple satellite offices are opening around Austin.

headline: Culture is Key
pros: The culture at LogicMonitor is beyond expectations. I came from a very similar environment as far as benefits are concerned. However, LogicMonitor has proven to be a much more enjoyable place to work. My coworkers are fabulous and I am truly amazed at the collaboration that is encouraged from the bottom up. The incentives to work effectively and efficiently are numerous and attractive.
cons: The office is really cold ;)

headline: Passion, Play, Pride
pros: You'd be hard-pressed to find a more passionate group of people, all centered around the product/service that they work so hard to sell, support and improve.
cons: Procedural documentation, while as amazing as it is, does seem to be getting "heaped" in favor of new versions, without being cleaned up. Lot of junk to sift through at times on internal documentation.

headline: Efficient Interview Process, Pleasant Workplace
pros: Employee for a short time. Interview process was fast and efficient, everyone here has been very friendly and welcoming. Well stocked snack kitchen, all sorts of other bonus benefits.
cons: As others have noted, parking downtown is tricky which makes it hard to get into the office if public transit isn't an option. 401k matching isn't available yet, though it's supposedly coming in the near future.

headline: Talent Acquisition Associate
pros: The culture seems amazing! Everyone I've met so far are really all so positive and friendly, the team I'm with has a wonderful sense of humor and make me feel welcomed and are willing to help me when I reach out. I am really looking forward to learning more from them!
cons: The parking can be a little difficult if you will be traveling by car.

headline: Fast Growing Company with LOTS of opportunity
pros: Excellent pay, great benefits, market leading product, excellent training, amazing culture and unlimited PTO
cons: You need to be at the office if you're not out seeing a client, generally speaking. but I don't mind because the environment is stellar.

headline: Challenging but fun
pros: Great team full of competent people, you get to build a great product that is going places. Great work life balance.
cons: The company is growing up and there are some growing pains. There is some distraction and ambiguity as the company enters a new stage.

headline: Great place, people, and opportunity!
pros:

- GREAT benefits
- Amazing culture and environment (Downtown Austin offie is beautiful)

headline: Sales Development
pros: It's an amazing place to work! There is such a great culture that surrounds this company, and everyone is truly happy to work there. They provide some great perks, but the beauty of the company is that they want this to be the best place that you could ever work.

headline: Best Job I've Ever Had

pros: Product is great and getting better everyday, the people in every group are responsive, open to new ideas and always jumping in to solve problems as they  come up.

pros: The company offers an extensive array of perks (and takes advantage of some of Santa Barbara's natural perks too).  It's obvious employees are truly valued.

headline: Great place to work
pros: Amazing product, easy to explain to people and truly a game-changer in the world of monitoring. What used to be an operational burden for teams can now be a competitive advantage for Ops and Dev and MSP teams.

headline: Exciting, and fast paced. This organization is lean and we'll positioned in the market space.
pros: Greatest people I've ever worked with. Dynamic and adaptable, with excellent benefits to boot.
cons: Requires buy-in. You're either with them it against them. There is employee churn if the fit isn't right.

headline: Went fantastic
pros:
The people here are great. Work environment is fantastic. The dynamic between teams is superb.

After you work at LM and test other monitoring software, you quickly realize how awesome the product is and working here is a blessing.

headline: Unchecked leadership, poor communication, great pay
pros: Pay is good, perks and benefits are awesome. Great if you want to hit autopilot and flush out work without questioning management or needing guidance, leadership or mentorship.
cons: Leadership is cut throat, not transparent or kept in check. Decisions from top down without communication. Shell company- Marketed as having great culture, but underneath is blind, disorganized and chaotic.

headline: Turnover, bad comp plans, and worse management
pros: The product is a legitimately good product. The support team is also extremely adept and does some of the best customer support in the industry.
cons:
Vista acquired LM and basically ruined it. The company I joined had keggers, a relaxed atmosphere, great sales performance, and lots of potential. By the time I left I was immensely relieved to be rid of the stress of working there, and I had one of the easier jobs! 

Despite already being a lean company, cost cutting was taken to a whole new level. They're hiring huge numbers of people but at a cut rate; they pay between 25-40% below market rate. Mostly they are taking advantage of younger people who don't know any better. They also quietly removed all the perks that made the place tolerable.

As others have pointed out the compensation plans are horrible. My manager fought valiantly just to get us a comp plan that wouldn't take money out of our pockets. The targets they gave the team were very unrealistic - I never saw a quarter where we exceeded quota, and most of the time we were very close to decelerators - you read that right, they put DECELERATORS in the comp plans. 

You'll be fought every time you try to take time off, accused of faking illness when you're actually sick, and generally abused. Take the advice I wish I could have given to the poor saps I saw being interviewed in our offices - RUN.

headline: Fast Growth Exhilarating Business

Innovation and creativity is required and encouraged. This is not a place you can come and coast and be handed things on a platter. Its fast growth but still very much an entrepreneurial start up vibe. If you want a relaxed slower pace environment where everything has been matured and you get handed accounts that require limited hustle then this isn't the place. In some cases people join and expect an easy ride. It is not that kind of place. Its a winning culture and people push each other to success. Hence some people don't make it.
Its a fun place, group of dynamic people looking to build something unique.
The monitoring space is one of the most important in IT.
cons: The EMEA business has growth 200% in a year, and sometimes there are a few mistakes in hiring with people who are not the right fit.

headline: Going from strength to strength!
pros:
When I joined, I knew I was joining a team that at its heart is a performance focussed sales culture. What I didn't realise was how much opportunity there is to grow as an individual through training, coaching and experience gained in being part of this team.

Alongside the sales team are a number of key departments that enable and augment the sales process throughout the lifecycle of a customer. The management team have been assembled to take the EMEA organisation to the next level under the guidance and direction of Daniela. Through refinement of process, staff development, promotion from within and a desire to be better every day in all areas LogicMonitor EMEA is going from strength to strength!

The culture and belief that everyone can make a difference each day, starts from the vision of the VP & General Manager of EMEA. The management team take that vision and apply to each of their own departments. Each team and engagement are unique and not restricted to one rule for all, but empowered to do whatever it takes to make progress towards our team goals.

The team I work in say this is the best team they have been a part of. You feel as if you have a real opportunity to grow and be supported in your development. It leads to a feeling of being part of something special, where as one team you become customer obsessed.

The level of support given to us as employees during the pandemic has been second to none. The thoughtfulness and insight shown in managing the workforce in these unprecedented times makes you feel very lucky to be part of the LogicMonitor family. I for one would not choose to be anywhere else!!
cons: It's a fast paced, challenging environment designed to make you the best version of yourself so that LogicMonitor can be the best software company in the World. We do work hard but we play harder. Do not apply, if you don't want to develop & grow!
